subtitle: A recipe that transforms cod steaks into something special.

method.text: Cut leek, celery and carrot into 5 cm pieces then cut into thin strips.
Season fish and place in a pan. Pile the prepared vegetable strips on top and pour the stock and sherry round the fish.
Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 7-10 min or until fish is cooked.
Arrange vegetables on serving plates top with the fish and keep warm.

Bring liquid to the boil and boil, uncovered for about 5 min until reduced to about 4 tablespoonfuls. Add fresh double cream and boil for 2 min - until sauce is thick enough to coat back of a spoon. Stir in butter, a little at a time, stirring continuously. Season to taste. Pour over the fish and garnish with parsley sprigs before serving.

title: Cod in creamy sherry sauce
